conclusion: Use properties of light refraction and geometry of the cube to solve the problem.
Refractive index n = 1.5 indicates light travels 1.5 times faster in glass compared to air.
Bubble is located at the center of the cube.
Determine minimum area of paper needed to block bubble's visibility from all directions.
Identify dimensions of the cube with side length a.
Distance from center to any face of the cube is a/2.
Light ray from center to bubble will be refracted into the glass.
Angle of incidence equals angle of reflection.
Calculate angle of incidence using refractive index n = 1.5: sin(theta) = 1/n.
Angle of reflection is also 36.87 degrees.
Angle between normal to face of cube and line from center to bubble is 90 degrees - 36.87 degrees = 53.13 degrees.
Radius of circle formed by paper is equal to distance from center of cube to bubble, which is a/2.
Minimum area of paper is area of circle with radius a/2.
Area of circle is pi*(a/2)^2 = pi*a^2/4.
Minimum area of paper is pi*a^2/4.
Final answer: Minimum area of each piece of paper is pi*a^2/4.
